caption:
Table 5. Evolution of weights for ConvLarge on CIFAR-10 

Value Scheduling 

? 0.003 Linear decrease to 0 over the last 1 /3 of the training 
?1 0.9 
Exponential decrease to 0.5 over the last 1 /5 of the training 
?c 1 
Exponential increase from 0 over 800 first batches 
?s 100 
Exponential increase from 0 over first 1 /4 of the training 
and exponential decrease to 0 over the last 1 /5 of the training 
?r 1 
Exponential decrease over the last 5% of the training 

? is the learning rate, ?1 the first momentum of Adam, ?c the classification 
weight, ?s the stability weight, ?r the reconstructions weights. 
Exponential decrease follows the function exp(?5t 2 ) with t ? [0, 1] from the 
start to the end of the decreasing interval. When increasing, t goes from 1 
to 0.
